intro: Capnites tenuilobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed capnites, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves with finely toothed margins. Its small, tubular flowers are typically purple or violet, clustered in whorls along the stems. Capnites tenuilobus is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and disturbed soils.
